description: The dashboard shows overall network RTT metrics for all sources and destinations

panels.description: Shows average ping measurements grouped by destination host over selected time range
panels.title: Average Ping Measurements

panels.description: Shows average mean RTT metrics over selected time range (with package loss). Displayed values is a values for whole probe which includes $packets_num packets sent

targets.query: SELECT mean("rtt_mean") FROM "t_network_latency" WHERE "source" = '$source' AND "protocol" = '$protocol' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(none)
SELECT mean("rtt_max") FROM "t_network_latency" WHERE "source" = '$source' AND "protocol" = '$protocol' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(none)
SELECT mean("rtt_min") FROM "t_network_latency" WHERE "source" = '$source' AND "protocol" = '$protocol' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(none)

SELECT (round(mean("sent")) - round(mean("received"))) / round(mean("sent")) * 100 FROM "t_network_latency" WHERE "source" = '$source' AND "protocol" = '$protocol' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(previous)

panels.title: Average Mean RTT

panels.description: Shows average values of ping measurements grouped by destination host over selected time range. Click on a destination node to open dashboard with detailed information

targets.expr: (round(avg(network_latency_sent{protocol="$protocol", source=~"$source"}) by (destination)) - round(avg(network_latency_received{protocol="$protocol", source=~"$source"}) by (destination))) / round(avg(network_latency_sent{protocol="$protocol", source=~"$source"}) by (destination)) * 100
targets.query: SELECT (round(mean("sent")) - round(mean("received"))) / round(mean("sent")) * 100 as "avg_loss",  mean("rtt_mean") as "avg_rtt", mean("rtt_stddev") as "avg_stddev", round(mean("hops_num")) as "hops" FROM "t_network_latency" WHERE "source" =~ /$source/ AND "protocol" = '$protocol' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "destination"

panels.title: Ping Measurements From $source To All Hosts

panels.description: Shows average mean RTT metrics over selected time range (with package loss). Displayed values is a values for whole probe which includes $packets_num packets sent

targets.query: SELECT mean("rtt_mean") FROM "t_network_latency" WHERE "source" = '$source' AND "protocol" = '$protocol' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(none)
SELECT mean("rtt_max") FROM "t_network_latency" WHERE "source" = '$source' AND "protocol" = '$protocol' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(none)
SELECT mean("rtt_min") FROM "t_network_latency" WHERE "source" = '$source' AND "protocol" = '$protocol' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(none)

SELECT (round(mean("sent")) - round(mean("received"))) / round(mean("sent")) * 100 FROM "t_network_latency" WHERE "source" = '$source' AND "protocol" = '$protocol' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(previous)

panels.title: Average Mean RTT

panels.description: Shows average values of ping measurements grouped by destination host over selected time range. Click on a destination node to open dashboard with detailed information

targets.expr: (round(avg(network_latency_sent{protocol="$protocol", source=~"$source"}) by (destination)) - round(avg(network_latency_received{protocol="$protocol", source=~"$source"}) by (destination))) / round(avg(network_latency_sent{protocol="$protocol", source=~"$source"}) by (destination)) * 100
targets.query: SELECT (round(mean("sent")) - round(mean("received"))) / round(mean("sent")) * 100 as "avg_loss",  mean("rtt_mean") as "avg_rtt", mean("rtt_stddev") as "avg_stddev", round(mean("hops_num")) as "hops" FROM "t_network_latency" WHERE "source" =~ /$source/ AND "protocol" = '$protocol' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "destination"

panels.title: Ping Measurements From $source To All Hosts

params.q: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM "t_network_latency" WITH KEY = "source"
SHOW TAG VALUES FROM "t_network_latency" WITH KEY = "protocol" WHERE "source" =~ /()/
SHOW TAG VALUES FROM "t_network_latency" WITH KEY = "interval"
SHOW TAG VALUES FROM "t_network_latency" WITH KEY = "packets"

title: Network Latency Overview
